content.question:
<math alttext="The figure presents a 2 row table, with 8 columns of data. The heading for row 1 is “x,” and the heading for row 2 is “f of x.” The data in the table are as follows. Column 1. x is 2.9. f of x is 3.4. Column 2. x is 2.95. f of x is 3. 1. Column 3. x is 2.99. f of x is 3.004. Column 4. x is 2.999. f of x is 3.00004. Column 5. x is 3.001. f of x is 3.00004. Column 6. x is 3.01. f of x is 3.004. Column 7. x is 3.05. f of x is 3.1. Column 8. x is 3.1. f of x is 3.4." overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtable columnlines="solid" columnspacing="0.0em" columnwidth="3em 0.05em 3em 3em 4em 5em 5em 4em 3em 3em" equalrows="true" frame="solid" framespacing="0.0em 0.5ex" rowlines="solid" rowspacing="1ex" width="auto"><mtr><mtd><mi>x</mi></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.25ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mn>2.9</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>2.95</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>2.99</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>2.999</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>3.001</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>3.01</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>3.05</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>3.1</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.25ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mn>3.4</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>3.1</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>3.004</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>3.00004</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>3.00004</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>3.004</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>3.1</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>3.4</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>
The table above gives selected values for a function <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. Based on the data in the table, which of the following could not be the graph of <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> on the interval <math alttext="2.9 is less than or equal to x, which is less than or equal to 3.1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.9</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>3.1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: The figure presents a graph of a curve in the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The numbers 2.9 through 3.1, in increments of 0.05, are indicated on the x axis. The numbers 1 through 5, in increments of 1, are indicated on the y axis. The curve begins at a point to the left of x equals 2.9, and just below y equals 4. It moves gradually downward and to the right, leveling off as it reaches a minimum at a closed circle at the point with coordinates 3 comma 3. It then moves gradually upward until it ends at a point to the right of x equals 3.1, and just below y equals 4.

The figure presents a graph of a curve in the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The numbers 2.9 through 3.1, in increments of 0.05, are indicated on the x axis. The numbers 1 through 5, in increments of 1, are indicated on the y axis. The curve begins at a point to the left of x equals 2.9, and just below y equals 4. It moves gradually downward and to the right, leveling off as it reaches a minimum at an open circle at the point with coordinates 3 comma 3. The curve continues after the open circle, and moves gradually upward until it ends at a point to the right of x equals 3.1, and just below y equals 4.

The figure presents a graph of a curve in the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The numbers 2.9 through 3.1, in increments of 0.05, are indicated on the x axis. The numbers 1 through 5, in increments of 1, are indicated on the y axis. The curve begins at a point to the left of x equals 2.9, and just below y equals 4. It moves gradually downward and to the right, leveling off as it reaches a minimum at an open circle at the point with coordinates 3 comma 3. Directly below the open circle, is a closed circle at the point with coordinates 3 comma 2. The curve continues after the open circle, and moves gradually upward until it ends at a point to the right of x equals 3.1, and just below y equals 4.

The figure presents a graph of two curves in the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The numbers 2.9 through 3.1, in increments of 0.05, are indicated on the x axis. The numbers 1 through 5, in increments of 1, are indicated on the y axis. The first curve begins at a point to the left of x equals 2.9, and just below y equals 3. It moves gradually downward and to the right, leveling off as it ends at a closed circle at the point with coordinates 3 comma 2. Directly above the closed circle, is an open circle at the point with coordinates 3 comma 3. The second curve begins at this open circle, and moves gradually upward until it ends at a point to the right of x equals 3.1, and just below y equals 4.

content.answer: The figure presents a graph of two curves in the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The numbers 2.9 through 3.1, in increments of 0.05, are indicated on the x axis. The numbers 1 through 5, in increments of 1, are indicated on the y axis. The first curve begins at a point to the left of x equals 2.9, and just below y equals 3. It moves gradually downward and to the right, leveling off as it ends at a closed circle at the point with coordinates 3 comma 2. Directly above the closed circle, is an open circle at the point with coordinates 3 comma 3. The second curve begins at this open circle, and moves gradually upward until it ends at a point to the right of x equals 3.1, and just below y equals 4.

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Identify a re-expression of mathematical information presented in a given representation
